newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Indonesia seen allocating 3.6 mln bbls LSWR in May.
newsitem.headline: Indonesia seen allocating 3.6 mln bbls LSWR in May.

text.p: Indonesia's state oil company Pertamina is expected to allocate about 3.6 million barrels of low sulphur waxy residue (LSWR) for lifting in May, industry sources said on Thursday.
Pertamina is also likely to roll over around 500,000 barrels from April, bringing the total May allocation to 4.1 million barrels, they said.

Traders said in April, Pertamina exported a total of 5.1 million barrels. It initially allocated 3.6 million barrels but added another 500,000 barrels after it rolled over part of its March supplies into April.

Pertamina later allocated a further 1.5 million barrels in April after a fire disrupted one of two 27,500-barrel-per-day hydrocrackers at its Dumai refinery, bringing the total to 5.1 million barrels.
Traders said discussion was thin in the spot market as most traders awaited a clearer price direction after details of the loading schedule for May are released.
They said the arbitrage window to the West is currently open, draining some of the excess supplies in the East Asian markets.
A Western trader was reported to be seeking a vessel to move about one million barrels of LSWR for late April lifting from Indonesia to the U.S.
They said the current market is soft but might recover when demand from Japan and South Korea increase during summer.
LSWR prices in the Singapore spot market are bid/offered at $15.25/$15.75.
